page.title: 06RIVER COLN IN BIBURY
page.content: The River Coln is a 6m wide fast flowing freshwater river which flows through the centre of Bibury. It was originally used for washing the wool and for household uses. Nowadays, water is pumped out at the rate of a million gallons a day into a reservoir at Faringdon where it is purified for use as drinking water. The water is also used for cattle, fishing and as a general amenity. The river is a great tourist attraction and every day there is some-one there even when it is snowing. Next to the river is Rack Isle a wet grassland conservation area where mallards,moorhens,coots and mute swans can nest. In the river are brown trout, rainbow trout, graylings, golden orf, tadpoles and frogs and water voles and water rats which live in the embankments.
